CreateTaskFromAction.document: This API is used to create an experiment with an action.
CreateTaskFromAction.name: Creates an experiment with an action

CreateTaskFromTemplate.document: This API is used to create an experiment using a template.
CreateTaskFromTemplate.name: Creates an experiment using a template

DeleteTask.document: This API is used to delete a task.
DeleteTask.name: Deletes a task

DescribeActionFieldConfigList.document: This API is used to obtain the dynamic configuration parameters of the action field based on action ID, including action-specific parameters and common parameters.
DescribeActionFieldConfigList.name: Obtains the configuration parameter list of the action field

DescribeActionLibraryList.document: This API is used to obtain the action list of Chaotic Fault Generator.
DescribeActionLibraryList.name: Obtains the action list

DescribeObjectTypeList.document: This API is used to query the object type list.
DescribeObjectTypeList.name: Queries the object type list

DescribeTask.document: This API is used to query a task.
DescribeTask.name: Queries a task

DescribeTaskExecuteLogs.document: This API is used to obtain all logs generated during an experiment.
DescribeTaskExecuteLogs.name: Obtains logs generated during an experiment

DescribeTaskList.document: This API is used to query the task list.
DescribeTaskList.name: Queries the task list

DescribeTaskPolicyTriggerLog.document: This API is used to obtain the guardrail triggering logs.
DescribeTaskPolicyTriggerLog.name: Obtains guardrail triggering logs

DescribeTemplate.document: This API is used to query a template library.
DescribeTemplate.name: Queries a template library

DescribeTemplateList.document: This API is used to query the template list.
DescribeTemplateList.name: Queries the template list

ExecuteTask.document: This API is used to run a task.
ExecuteTask.name: Runs a task

ExecuteTaskInstance.document: This API is used to trigger the action of the chaos engineering experiment and perform an experiment on the instance.
ExecuteTaskInstance.name: Executes the task action on the instance

ModifyTaskRunStatus.document: This API is used to change the task running status.
ModifyTaskRunStatus.name: Changes the task running status

TriggerPolicy.document: This API is used to trigger the chaos engineering experiment guardrail (two types: trigger and recovery).
TriggerPolicy.name: Triggers the guardrail policy

ActionFieldConfigDetail.document: Response format of dynamic action parameters

members.document:
Component type
The options are as follows:
input: text box
textarea: multi-line text box
number: number input box
select: selector
cascader: cascade selector
radio: single choice
time: time selection
members.name: Type

members.document: Component label
members.name: Lable

members.document: Unique identifier of the component, key when it is sent back to the backend
members.name: Field

members.document:
Default value
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: DefaultValue

members.document:
The supported configuration items are as follows. You can select the configuration items as needed. If no configuration is required, set the value to {}.

{  placeholder: string (placeholder)

  tooltip: string (prompt message)

  reg: RegExp (regular expression for the input content format)

  max: number (maximum number of input characters for text boxes and upper limit of the input number for number input boxes)

  min: number (lower limit of the input number for number input boxes)

  step: number (step size for number input boxes; default value: 1)

  format: string (format for time selection, for example YYYY-MM-DD and YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss)

  separator: string[] (separator for multi-line input boxes. If it is left blank, no separator is used, and the text string entered by the user is returned directly.)

  multiple: boolean (multiple-choice or not, valid for selectors and cascade selectors)

  options: selector options (support the following two forms)

Directly provide the option array: { value: string; label: string }[]
Obtain options by calling the API: { api: string (API URL), params: string[] (interface parameters, corresponding to field of the parameter configuration. The frontend uses the input values of all components corresponding to field as parameters to query data. If no value is input, the frontend directly requests data when components are loaded.) 
}
}
members.name: Config

members.document: Whether it is required (0: no; 1: yes)

members.document: Experiment name. If this parameter is left blank, the action name is used by default.

members.name: TaskDescription

members.document: General action parameters, which need to be passed in after JSON serialization. The parameters can be obtained by using the action details API DescribeActionFieldConfigList. If this field is left blank, the default action parameters are used by default.
members.name: TaskActionGeneralConfiguration

members.document: Action custom parameters need to be passed in as json serialization. They can be obtained from the action details interface DescribeActionFieldConfigList. If not filled in, the default action parameters will be used. Note: Required parameters have no default values. Be sure to pass in valid values.

members.document: Automatic pause time of the experiment, in minutes. If this parameter is left blank, the automatic pause time of the template is used by default.

TaskGroupActionConfig.document: Action parameters in the action group

members.document: Order of this action in the action group. The entire order starts from 1. If this parameter is left blank or set to an invalid value, the action whose parameters need to be modified in the template cannot be matched.
members.name: TaskGroupActionOrder

members.document: General action parameters, which need to be passed in after JSON serialization. The parameters can be obtained by using the template details query API. If this field is left blank, action parameters in the template are used by default.
members.name: TaskGroupActionGeneralConfiguration

members.document: Custom action parameters, which need to be passed in after JSON serialization. The parameters can be obtained by using the template details query API. If this field is left blank, action parameters in the template are used by default.
members.name: TaskGroupActionCustomConfiguration

members.document: Instance object associated with the action group
members.name: TaskGroupInstances

members.document: Action group name. If this parameter is left blank, the action group name in the template is used by default.
members.name: TaskGroupTitle

members.document: Action group description. If this parameter is left blank, the action group description in the template is used by default.
members.name: TaskGroupDescription

members.document: Action group execution mode. 1: sequential execution; 2: execution by stage. If this parameter is left blank, the action execution mode in the template is used by default.
members.name: TaskGroupMode

members.document: Action parameters in the action group. If this field is left blank, the action parameters in the template is used by default. You only need to specify the action whose parameters are to be modified during configuration.
